project.teaser: "National Contact Points (NCPs) are officially appointed to advise researchers and other relevant, eligible stakeholders in their efforts to secure EU funding. In this context, the EU-funded Net4SocietyHE project is the transnational network for Horizon Europe’s Cluster 2:...
project.objective: "National Contact Points (NCPs) are officially appointed to advise researchers and other relevant, eligible stakeholders in their efforts to secure EU funding. In this context, the EU-funded Net4SocietyHE project is the transnational network for Horizon Europe’s Cluster 2: Culture, Creativity and Inclusive Society (CL2) NCPs. Building on past initiatives, the project will further develop services created by its predecessors to support today’s NCPs. To that end, it will design activities to ensure all CL2 NCPs have the relevant knowledge and skills required to offer a consistently high degree of professional, high-quality, tailor-made services to potential programme applicants. ""Net4SocietyHE” (N4SHE) is the transnational network for Cluster 2 ""Culture, Creativity and Inclusive Society"" (CL2) National Contact Points (NCPs) in Horizon Europe. NCPs are officially designated to advise researchers and other relevant, eligible stakeholders in their efforts to secure EU funding. N4SHE builds on Net4Society, the network for Societal Challenge 6 NCPs in H2020, and NCPs for Socio-economic Sciences and Humanities in FP7, and will further develop services and tools created by its predecessor to help NCPs to succeed in their work. Through its planned activities, N4SHE will ensure that all CL2 NCPs have the relevant knowledge and skills necessary to adequately and competently offer a consistently high-degree of professional, high-quality, tailor-made services to potential programme applicants. All nominated CL2 NCPs (including non-beneficiaries) will have access to information and capacity-building tools and events organised by the project, such as CL2 NCP info sessions, trainings, and network meetings. N4SHE will support prospective applicants in CL2, with a special focus on new stakeholders (e.g. CSOs, CCIs, GLAMs [galleries, libraries, archives, and museums]) and researchers from countries with lower-than-average results and participation in H2020. The project will facilitate multi-actor/interdisciplinary/international consortia-building through organisation of brokerages, bilateral meetings of project initiators and researchers from Widening countries, via use of a partner search platform tool. N4SHE will also organise info days and proposal check events to encourage participation and development of successful proposals. To support SSH Integration across Horizon Europe, N4SHE will organise SSH-themed brokerages, special trainings on the topic for NCPs, and publish an ""SSH Opportunities"" document, highlighting SSH research funding chances beyond flagged topics within Horizon Europe, including in missions and partnerships, and separately publicise opportunities in other EU Programmes, in addition to other actions."
project.title: "Network of National Contact Points for Cluster 2 ""Culture, Creativity and Inclusive society"" and ""SSH Integration"""
project.keywords: NCP, Cluster 2, social sciences, humanities, capacity building, SSH integration, SSH impact, consortium building, international cooperation, funding opportunities, interdisciplinarity

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Net4SocietyHE (Network of National Contact Points for Cluster 2 "Culture, Creativity and Inclusive society" and "SSH Integration")
result.teaser: Net4SocietyHE (N4SHE) is the transnational network for Cluster 2 "Culture, Creativity and Inclusive Society" (CL2) National Contact Points (NCPs) in Horizon Europe. NCPs are officially designated to advise researchers and other relevant, eligible stakeholders in their efforts...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Welcome package for newcomer CL2 NCPs
result.description: This deliverable consists of a collection of useful documents stemming from the current and previous versions of the Net4Society project (i.e. FAQs, an overview of CL2 priorities and destinations, and an overview of N4SHE project activities, a brief profile of network members, useful advice on standard NCP services (e.g. info days), and tips on supporting the proposal writing process).

result.title: "1st set of training material ""SSH ambassador"""
result.description: This deliverable is a collection of training materials on the topic of SSH Intergration in Horizon Europe (powerpoint slides, for example, tips on how to foster interdisciplinary consortia building, main aspects of SSH Integration). The content will be designed for use by non-Cluster 2 and Cluster 2 NCPs on their websites, during their events, and other promotional material.

result.title: Website
result.description: This deliverable corresponds to the launch of Net4SocietyHE's project website, which will contain important and relevant information related to Cluster 2 in Horizon Europe. The website will also have a section dedicated to Cluster 2 NCPs, which will be regularly updated with tips, FAQs, and other practical matter related to Cluster 2 NCP work.

result.title: Impact Plan
result.description: This deliverable is Net4SocietyHE's Impact Strategy (Plan), and will outline the strategy to be used by the project to create and achieve impact of planned activities. It will contain a overview of relevant KPIs within the project for this purpose.

result.title: Report on identified stakeholder groups and entry barriers
result.description: This deliverable is a report detailing various new stakeholder groups that have been identified for participation in Cluster 2, for example actors from the CCIs, GLAM, and CSO areas, and the type and nature of barriers which inhibit their participation in the Horizon Europe Programme.

result.title: Guidelines for Cluster 2 NCPs and future applicants
result.description: This deliverable is a set of practical guidelines developed to support Cluster 2 NCPs and applicants in Cluster 2 with understanding the requirements associated with applying for funding in Horizon Europe Cluster 2.

result.title: First audio (e.g. podcast)
result.description: This deliverable corresponds to the publication/release of audio recordings on a topic of importance/relevance to Cluster 2 stakeholders and NCPs. Possible subjects will be intrviews with successful candidates highlighting their paths to success in Horizon Europe, or brief tutorials on Net4SocietyHE tools and services.

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: This deliverable is Net4SocietyHE's data management plan and will outline the agreed upon standards for the handling, accessing, storage, and preservation of data generated and used during the project. These standards will be based to all extents possible on the FAIR principle and in accordance with the European Commission's Open Science requirements.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination, and Exploitation Plan
result.description: This deliverable is Net4Society's Communication, Dissemination, and Exploitation Plan. This plan will outline the various communication tools and channels to be used by the project, as well as the strategy that will be used to communicate information related to planned project events, and to disseminate, and exploit project results to the project's identified target groups. The plan will also provide an overview of these target groups and key performance indicators (KPI).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
